trans-unit.source: Adapt tests to Products.GenericSetup >= 2.0, thus requiring at least that version. [icemac] (#22)
trans-unit.target: Adapt tests to Products.GenericSetup >= 2.0, thus requiring at least that version. [icemac] (#22)

trans-unit.source: Added
trans-unit.target: Añadido

trans-unit.source: Added “update security” as an option field on local configuration management form, as in most cases updating catalog role mappings can be a very long operation and is better to be made as a separate upgrade step. [alecghica]
trans-unit.target: Added “update security” as an option field on local configuration management form, as in most cases updating catalog role mappings can be a very long operation and is better to be made as a separate upgrade step. [alecghica]

trans-unit.source: Added ‘CMFPlacefulWorkflow: Manage workflow policies’ permission. ManageWorkflowPolicies is no longer ‘Manage portal’, it’s now assigned to ‘CMFPlacefulWorkflow: Manage workflow policies’. [alecghica]
trans-unit.target: Added ‘CMFPlacefulWorkflow: Manage workflow policies’ permission. ManageWorkflowPolicies is no longer ‘Manage portal’, it’s now assigned to ‘CMFPlacefulWorkflow: Manage workflow policies’. [alecghica]

trans-unit.source: Added upgrade step to apply our full profile. This is meant mostly for upgrades from ancient versions that had no profile yet or had a profile without a metadata.xml. In that case the quick installer would complain that the old profile version was unknown and there was no upgrade. [maurits]
trans-unit.target: Se ha añadido un paso de actualización para aplicar nuestro perfil completo.Esto es principalmente para las actualizaciones de versiones antiguas que no tenían un perfil todavía o tenían un perfil sin un metadata.xml.En ese caso el instalador rápido se quejaría de que la versión antigua del perfil era desconocida y no había ninguna actualización.[maurits]

trans-unit.source: Change the workflow for the content type “Folder” from “folder_workflow” to plone_workflow”, and click on “Save”. Now all your content types should use the “plone_workflow”.
trans-unit.target: Change the workflow for the content type “Folder” from “folder_workflow” to plone_workflow”, and click on “Save”. Now all your content types should use the “plone_workflow”.

trans-unit.source: Made sure you cannot set a workflow configuration on a non-folderish item in the site root. The actual configuration would end up on the site root. [hannosch]
trans-unit.target: Asegúrate de que no puedes establecer una configuración de flujo de trabajo en un elemento que no sea de carpeta en la raíz del sitio.La configuración real terminaría en la raíz del sitio.[hannosch]

trans-unit.source: Made worflow policies translatable in prefs_workflow_localpolicies_form. [vincentfretin]
trans-unit.target: Hizo las políticas de flujo de trabajo traducibles en forma de prefs_workflow_localpolicies_form.[vincentfretin]

trans-unit.source: Major cleanup of old stuff [tomgross]
trans-unit.target: Limpieza mayor de cosas viejas [tomgross]

trans-unit.source: Make CMFPlacefulWorkflow tool an ImmutableId object, but not a UniqueObject. The UniqueObject base class specifies that it is impossible to have any other object with the same id (portal_placeful_workflow). This was breaking in-ZODB GenericSetup snapshots, because the GenericSetup sub-folder for placeful workflow policies happens to also be called portal_placeful_workflow. Plone has a checkId script which disallows shadowing tools anyway, so the UniqueObject base class is a nicety rather than a necessity. [optilude]
trans-unit.target: Hacer que la herramienta CMFPlacefulWorkflow sea un objeto ImmutableId,pero no un UniqueObject.La clase base de UniqueObject especifica que es imposible tener cualquier otro objeto con el mismo id (portal_placeful_workflow).Esto estaba rompiendo las instantáneas del GenericSetup de ZODB,porque la subcarpeta del GenericSetup para las políticas de flujo de trabajo placentero también se llama portal_placeful_workflow.Plone tiene un script checkId que no permite herramientas de sombreado de todos modos,por lo que la clase base UniqueObject es una bondad en lugar de una necesidad.[optilude]

trans-unit.source: Minor packaging updates. (#1)
trans-unit.target: Actualizaciones menores del embalaje.(#1)

trans-unit.target: Mover la dependencia de Productos.PloneTestCase para probar extra y así eliminar la dependencia dura implícita de Productos.ATContentTypes.[thet]

trans-unit.target: Nuevas características:

trans-unit.source: New:
trans-unit.target: Nuevo:

trans-unit.source: No changes.
trans-unit.target: No hay cambios.

trans-unit.source: Now it would be interesting to change the workflow policy setting in the Plone site. Let’s first change the workflow policy for “Below this Folder” to “Default Policy”. You will find that the second folder does not more have the “submit” transition.
trans-unit.target: Now it would be interesting to change the workflow policy setting in the Plone site. Let’s first change the workflow policy for “Below this Folder” to “Default Policy”. You will find that the second folder does not more have the “submit” transition.

trans-unit.source: Now you can define and apply local workflow policies through the Plone Interface.
trans-unit.target: Ahora puedes definir y aplicar políticas de flujo de trabajo locales a través de la Interfaz de Plone.

trans-unit.source: Now you have a new policy. Enter the title “Example policy” and the description “This is an example policy”.
trans-unit.target: Now you have a new policy. Enter the title “Example policy” and the description “This is an example policy”.

trans-unit.source: Now you have a workflow policy in your site, and you can set the workflow policies for this folder and below.
trans-unit.target: Ahora tienes una política de flujo de trabajo en tu sitio,y puedes establecer las políticas de flujo de trabajo para esta carpeta y las siguientes.

trans-unit.source: Now, let’s define a new workflow policy:
trans-unit.target: Now, let’s define a new workflow policy:

trans-unit.source: Now, when you access the “State” drop-down list, you will see that you have the possibility to “submit” the folder. The submit transition only exists in the “plone_workflow”, and is absent from the “folder_workflow”, which demonstrates that the workflow policy we have chosen is used for the “Folder” content type.
trans-unit.target: Now, when you access the “State” drop-down list, you will see that you have the possibility to “submit” the folder. The submit transition only exists in the “plone_workflow”, and is absent from the “folder_workflow”, which demonstrates that the workflow policy we have chosen is used for the “Folder” content type.

trans-unit.source: PEP8 and frosted cleanup [tomgross]
trans-unit.target: PEP8 y limpieza de escarcha [tomgross]

trans-unit.source: Placeful Workflow is a Plone product that allows you to define workflow policies that define content type to workflow mappings that can be applied in any sub-folder of your Plone site:
trans-unit.target: Placeful Workflow es un producto Plone que permite definir políticas de flujo de trabajo que definen el tipo de contenido a los mapeos de flujo de trabajo que se pueden aplicar en cualquier subcarpeta de su sitio Plone:

trans-unit.source: The
trans-unit.target: El

trans-unit.source: The Placeful Workflow tool (portal_placeful_workflow) is installed by the installer. It provides a few configuration options so that you use to create you workflow policies through the ZMI.
trans-unit.target: La herramienta Placeful Workflow (portal_placeful_workflow)es instalada por el instalador.Proporciona algunas opciones de configuración para que usted utilice para crear sus políticas de flujo de trabajo a través del ZMI.

trans-unit.source: The next page will let you add a policy to your folder by clicking on the “Add Workflow policy” link. Click on “Add Workflow policy”.
trans-unit.target: The next page will let you add a policy to your folder by clicking on the “Add Workflow policy” link. Click on “Add Workflow policy”.

trans-unit.source: Then, let’s add a Folder to see whether the new workflow policy is active. Go to the root of your site and select “Folder” from the “Add new item” drop-down list. Enter the id “myfolder”, the title “My folder” and the description “This is my folder”, and click on “Save”.
trans-unit.target: Then, let’s add a Folder to see whether the new workflow policy is active. Go to the root of your site and select “Folder” from the “Add new item” drop-down list. Enter the id “myfolder”, the title “My folder” and the description “This is my folder”, and click on “Save”.

trans-unit.source: This product is the implementation of a PLIP initiated by Maik Röder: http://plone.org/products/plone/roadmap/52
trans-unit.target: This product is the implementation of a PLIP initiated by Maik Röder: http://plone.org/products/plone/roadmap/52

trans-unit.source: Updated Site Setup link in all control panels. Fixes https://github.com/plone/Products.CMFPlone/issues/1255 [davilima6]
trans-unit.target: Updated Site Setup link in all control panels. Fixes https://github.com/plone/Products.CMFPlone/issues/1255 [davilima6]

trans-unit.source: Updated the placeful_workflow import step to depends on typeinfo, as we need to make sure all types are available when importing the local policies. [deo]
trans-unit.target: Actualizado el paso de importación placeful_workflow a depende de typeinfo,ya que necesitamos asegurarnos de que todos los tipos están disponibles al importar las políticas locales.[deo]

trans-unit.source: Usage
trans-unit.target: Uso

trans-unit.source: Use Site Setup -> Add-on Products panel to install
trans-unit.target: Use Site Setup -> Add-on Products panel to install

trans-unit.source: Use i18n_domain=cmfplacefulworkflow in profiles.zcml to be able to translate the title and description of the profile. This refs http://dev.plone.org/plone/ticket/9864 [vincentfretin]
trans-unit.target: Use i18n_domain=cmfplacefulworkflow in profiles.zcml to be able to translate the title and description of the profile. This refs http://dev.plone.org/plone/ticket/9864 [vincentfretin]

trans-unit.target: Usa el decorador de zope.interface.[gforcada]

trans-unit.source: We didn’t add any workflow policies, so you don’t have a choice of different workflow policies yet, so the default workflow policy will be taken both for the folder and below.
trans-unit.target: We didn’t add any workflow policies, so you don’t have a choice of different workflow policies yet, so the default workflow policy will be taken both for the folder and below.

trans-unit.source: When you access the root of your site, you will see a new action in the workflow state drop-down menu called “policy”. Click on the “policy” link.
trans-unit.target: When you access the root of your site, you will see a new action in the workflow state drop-down menu called “policy”. Click on the “policy” link.

trans-unit.source: Workflow policies for Plone
trans-unit.target: Políticas de flujo de trabajo para Plone

trans-unit.source: You can add an additional workflow policy in the first folder, which assigns the “My policy” for “In this Folder”, so the second folder will once again have the “submit” transition.
trans-unit.target: You can add an additional workflow policy in the first folder, which assigns the “My policy” for “In this Folder”, so the second folder will once again have the “submit” transition.
